content.question: A particle moves along a straight line with velocity given by <math alttext="v of t equals, the fraction with numerator t squared minus 2 t, and denominator e to the t power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the total distance traveled by the particle from time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to the time the particle first changes direction?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
